ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: this was a 2 week intensive course, and the workload was therefore heavy esp. with 3 hours of class every day for 2 weeks, but it was worth it. just be prepared to be tired!
I really enjoyed this accelerated course.
lacks comparative descriptions on the similar issues of international importance
Prof Robinson's lectures!
The professors knowledge. They know so much about international comparative law and I found the class to be fascinating. They guided us in a way that was really helpful.
writing a paper with a topic of interest chosen by ourselves. It was a great experience being able to write about what we care most about in the context of environmental law.
The class discussions
Professor Robinson
Professor Robinson!
The experience of writing our own analyses was certainly challenging, but very instructive. It was my first time working with statues and laws, and I know feel much more comfortable.
The guidance and lectures received in preparation to the final paper. I am new to this area (environmental Law) and having Prof. Robinson was most gratifying.
Prof. Robinson put lot of inputs.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Sometimes the classes were too long or unstructured and seemed to get off-topic.

I really enjoyed the condensed format of the course. I would even recommend trying to do the course in 1 week if possible. I would prefer having the course take place earlier in the semester, though, to give more time for working on the paper. As it is currently structured, the class ends right before spring break, meaning that students have only 6 weeks or so after spring break to get all of the research and writing done--which can be a challenge if one needs to send emails to people working in the field and wait for responses.
the intensive course schedule- three hours a day for two weeks does not make it easy to digest and reflect before new info comes in.
The schedule
More structured lectures

It would be great to be able to learn more from classmates - it would be great to maybe have presentations or informal chats about all of our projects. It might also be good to set up a law librarian coming to class to give a little tutorial on how to use law library resources optimally.
This law course is supposed to compare the legal issues of utmost importance and finally one should know that where and what is better and where and is the best.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: all very available
Very good.
The TA was very responsive to all questions and concerns. Excellent TA!
profs- the advice and help were great, both constructive and responsive.
I contacted the 2 instructors and TA and they were all very helpful
Fine
very available
Both were available to meet and were very genours with their time.
Responsive to emails.
If we take out Prof. Robinson out of this course it stands collapsed

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: working on international environmental affairs and understanding how different legal systems work is critical to being effective.
It fit perfectly as the professors were very open to me finding a topic that was very interesting to me.
The course is not related to my academic background but very relevant to my future career. I loved it!
I was able to tailor the course to my interests.
For this class we were able to focus on any environmental topic we wanted to analyze - so insofar as one might be working with law and legal systems, this course is helpful.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: to gain a different perspective on environmental law.
Was interested in international supply chain issues.
For more understanding of the legal aspect of environmental management
I took the international environmental law course and wanted to take another course by Professor Robinson.
To learn about different law systems around the globe and how environmentalists can influence those systems.
See above responses.

I took this course because I wished to get acquainted with the environmental law methods for analysis and comparison. My expertise is in Ecosystem Services. As a new and popular policy, I wanted to have the guidance to compare the national policy of Costa Rica, a country I worked in for my Thesis, with Brazil, a country I will be moving to after graduating from F&ES.
to know about the comparative scenario of environmental legal frame work

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: yes and more! I wasn't sure how useful it would be initially but it would have been a mistake not to take it!
yes
Yes. Two weeks of 3-hour-per-day class time is tiring, but it is nice to have the coursework out of the way to focus on the research part of the class.
Yes it did

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: no groups were required

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: skim the readings, don't necessarily do all of them - they're often covered in lecture.
Just enjoy it and meet with the professors asoften as possible.
Consult the instructors about your topic because they are very willing to help you!
Students should endeavor to apply the class information to their respective areas of interests
Tap the expertise of Professor Robinson.
The paper is very challenging - make sure to utilize the professors' time, which they give generously and utilize the help provided by librarians.

Start drafting your paper very soon after the last class. Prof. Robinson's availability is scarce and very useful if you are new to this area. DO NOT just stop at the outline. Advance with your work and see if you can get in touch with the people they have contact with.
better to opt for other law courses taught at law college
